42 [Teofle.]
TEofle was a swyþe gret man : And guod clerk he was al-so,
hext Maister bi-fore alle oþere : under þe bischope i-do.
Þo þe bischop was ded : Teofle was forth ibrou&yogh;t
to beon bischop aftur him. : ake natheles he nolde [nout],[nout added later.]
And seide þat he nas nou&yogh;t wuyrþe þare-to : and guod he couþe to luyte.
Þat folke made ane oþerne sone : with grete nobleye and with pruyte.
Þo þe bischop in[MS. is] his power was : to teofle wrathþe he caste,
For he was raþur to bischope i-chose : and with þe oþur bischope heold faste :
he dude him out of his mester : and is guod him bi-nam.
So þat Teofle þare-aftur-ward : in-to grete pouerte bi-cam;
Al-so riche man ase he was er : ase pouere he was þo;
So þat he nuste &yogh;ware-bi libbe. : welle, þat him was wo!
Þo he was in Miseise i-brou&yogh;t : him schamede swiþe sore :
Men þat him honoured er : þo nolden huy non-more;
Ech man tolde luyte of himâ€” : for of þe pouere Men wollez so.
he ne mi&yogh;te for schame a-mong men come : he nuste &yogh;wat for-to do,
Þene deth he wilnede þingue mest. : so þat he him bi-þou&yogh;te
Þat, ho-so þene feond serui wolde : in grete richesse he him brou&yogh;te.
to a giv he wende a ny&yogh;t : þat wonede þare-bi-side;
he bad him helpe of þat cas : þat gan him þare bi-tide,
And him to serui for richesse : þene deuel a-boute wel wide.
"Wel, it schal beo," þe giv seide : "ake &yogh;eot þou most a-bide;
Cum oþur ny&yogh;t þis tyme : In þis stude here to me
And i-chulle þe swuch red do : þat wel schal liki þe."
¶ Teofle ne fur-&yogh;at nou&yogh;t þis. : to þe giv he eode
In þat ilke stude þat oþur ni&yogh;t : to beten is grete neode.
"Cum forth with me," quath þe giv : "ase ich þe wolle lede.
Ake of &yogh;wat þu iseo oþur heore : ne haue þou none drede,
Ne make no signe of þe creoyz : ne þeron ne þench ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t,
And in swuche richesse nere þou neuere : ase þov worst sone i-brou&yogh;t."
TEofle wende forth with him : and dude ase he him sede.
Into a priue stude he cam sone : ase þe giv gan him lede :
Þene heie feond he fond þere : Maister of alle quede,
And al his maynie a-boute him : for-to a-counti heore mis-dede.
"&YOGH;wat is he þat ilke," quath þe schrewe : "þat þov bringuest with þe?"
"he schal beon of þine," quath þe giv : "and for neode he cam to þe.
A man he was of gret pouwer : þat is nouþe him bi-nome,
And for-to bringue him into richesse[al. him in] a-&yogh;ein : þi Man he schal bi|come."
"Wel-come, beu frere," þe feond seide : "nouþe þou dost wel, i-wis!
haddest þov i-don þus mani day : riche þou were are þis.
bi-com mi Man, and do me homage : and þov schalt beo riche i-nov&yogh;;
For I-nelle no man helpe bote mine owene : and elles I dude wov&yogh;."
¶ "Ich bi-come þi man," quath Teofle : "and clanliche to þe take."[al. 4 vv. more.]
"Certes, beau frere," quath þe Deuel : "wel muche þov most for|sake :
Þov most fur-sake god þat þe schop : and alle halewene also."
"And ich heom for-sake," Teofle seide : "for þine wille ichulle do."
"Saunz faille, beu frere," þe Deuel seide : "þou ne mi&yogh;test speke no bet.
Þou art nouþe sone riche man I-nov&yogh;. : ake oþing &yogh;eot þe let;
bote þou it do, it is for nou&yogh;t : al þat we habbez i-do :
Þou most for-sake for-with[al. forþ mid] god : Marie, is moder, al-so;
For bote þou it wolle do : i-nam siker of þe nou&yogh;tâ€”
For manie þat weren in Mine se[r]uise : heo hath fram me ibrou&yogh;t."
"And ich fur-sake," Teofle seide : "hire sone, and hire al-so,
And þe ich bi-take lijf and soule : al þine wille to do."
"Ov, beu frere," þe deuel seide : "&yogh;eot ich am a-drad :
For Marie so ofte hath : mine Men fram me i-lad;
Word nis a-&yogh;ein hire bote wind : for þei a man hire for-sake,
&YOGH;if he wole a-&yogh;ein to hire i-wende : gladliche heo wole him take.
Þare-fore ichulle beon siker of þe : er ich mongy with þe :
guode chartres of þis foreward : þou schalt makie me,
And writen hire with þine owene honde : and a-selen hire al-so.
&YOGH;wan þou hast i-don al þis : þine wille ichulle do."
Teofle grauntede þis a-non : þe chartre he wrou&yogh;te sone
And a-selede hire with is ryng : ase foreward was to done;
he sat on kneo and tok is maister : and custe is fet al-so.
"Nouþe, teofle," þe schrewe seide : "þov hast al wel i-dc.
Þis chartre ichulle so faste bi[bi superscrbd.]-louke : In helle, &yogh;wanne ich hom come,
Þat I ne drede me nou&yogh;t þat heo worþe : þoru&yogh; Marie me bi-nome.
And wiend þou hom, and beo studefast : ase ichulle a&yogh;ein þe :
So riche man nere þou neuere : ase þou worst sone þoru me."
Þe feond wende hom to helle : and teofle hom al-so,
And þonkede þe gywe alle guode : þat he him hadde ido.
A-Morewe, so sone ase hit was day : þe bischop after teofle sende,
Þat he to him wel hasteliche : with-oute ani defaute wende.
Merci he criede wel deolfulliche : þo he to him cam,
And bi-tok him a&yogh;ein is power : þat he er him bi-nam.
Teofle bi-cam a-non so riche : þat so riche man non nas;
Ase louerd and sire ech man him heold : wel muche is power was;
Eche man was glad to queme him. : Men wondreden of þat cas,
And seiden, "it nis in þis world : bote si haut e si bas."
Worldes richesse he hadde i-nou&yogh; : and worldes blisse al-so.
Alas, þat ani cristine Man scholde : in þat manere come þare-to!
¶ Hit bi-feol þare-after-ward : In wel luyte stounde
Þat þe giv þat him þere-to brou&yogh;te : with tricherie was i-founde;
I-nome he was and to dome i-brou&yogh;t : and to strongue deþe i-do :
Fur-barnd he was þoru Iuggement : and to late he was so!
¶ Þo teofle him onder-stodâ€”: In is heorte he þou&yogh;te
Þat þe Deuel, with &yogh;wam þe giv was : to þulke deþe him brou&yogh;te.
Þou&yogh;te he, "nam ich al-so with him? : and þei ich beo riche ane stounde,
Ne schal ich neuere i-wite þe tyme : are he me bringue to grounde :
Þanne were ich fur-lore lijf and soule! : and ich am to him i-bounde
So faste, þat Ine may me with-drawe. : alas þat ilke stounde!
Alas, &yogh;wy ne hadde ich i-beo raþur ded : þane[MS. þanne] i-don þulke dede!
Nabbe ich fur-sake heom echone : þat me scholden helpe and rede?
hou mi&yogh;te ich hopie of grace : &yogh;wane ich heom habbe fur-sake?
A sunful wreche ich am, alas : nas neuere i-seie mi make!
god is so ri&yogh;tful þat to him : ne hopie ich nou&yogh;t þere-fore.
bote ich habbe ore leuedie grace : certus, ich am fur-lore.
For heo was euere ful of milce : and þei ich hire habbe for-sake,
hou ich euere þare-of spede : to hire grace ichulle me take."
To churche he wende to ore leuedi auter : and cride hire milce and ore,
his kneon he beot a-&yogh;ein þe eorþe : weopinde swyþe sore
On hire he cride and weop ful sore : boþe ny&yogh;t and day,
Out of þe chapele nolde he nou&yogh;t : ake euere þare-inne he lay.
FOurty dayes and fourty ny&yogh;t : on hire he criede faste.
hire milce, þat euere was so guod : heo scheowede him at þe laste :
For ase he criede on hire so &yogh;eorne : þat swete mayde so hende
cudde hire milde-hede, and fram heouene : to him a-doun gan wende.
"hov mi&yogh;te ich," heo seide, "þou wrechche Man : eny grace þe take,
And hou mi&yogh;te ich to mi sone for þe bidde : &yogh;wane þou hast him for-sake?"
"A, leuedi, leuedi," teofle seide : "nouþe, leuedi, þin ore!
Ich habbe i-sunegut manne mest : þat rewez me wel sore.
haue merci of þis sunfule wrechche! : I-nelle do sunne non-more,
Ake, &yogh;if þou wolt me þine grace &yogh;iue : Ichulle don al þi lore."
"Þov sunfule man," ore leuedi seide : "ase muche ase on me is,
to þe ichulle beo milde I-nov&yogh; : and to alle cristine men, i-wis :
For ich louie muche cristine Men : And norichi heom al-so,
and euere am redi to heom a-li&yogh;te : heore bone forto do;
And swiþe muche ich þolie ofte : mine sone to maken liþe,
Þat he ne nimez of heom grete wreche : ase he wolde ofte-siþe.
Ake sch[r]yf þe to him of þine sunnes : þat was i-bore of me
And þat þolede deth for sunfule men : and ichulle bidde for þe."
"Leuedi, merci," Teofle seide : "vnwuyrþe ich am þer-to,
with þat Mouth þat ich him for-sok : swuch schrift to him do."
"&YOGH;us, hardiliche," ore leuedi seide : "for he is milde and softe;
Wel þou wost þat sunfule men : gret loue he cuth wel ofte.
For he was for sunfule Men i-bore : and to deþe for heom i-do,
he mot nede to heom beo milde : for ri&yogh;t kuynde it wole so."
Teofle bi-gan þo weope and crie : "louerd, merci," he sede,
"to þe ich me schriue with deolful heorte : for mi luþer mis|dede.
haue merci of me, al-so wisliche : ase þou were for me i-bore
And for us þoledest deth : þat we ne scholden beo fur-lore!
Þench nouþe, louerd, on mine wrechhede! : swete Ihesu, þin ore!
Do me þine milce, ich bidde þe, louerd : i-nelle do sunne neuere-eft more."
¶ "Teofle, teofle," ore leuedi seide : "for þi cristine-dom,
An for pite þat ich habbe of cristine men : sethþe mi sone mi flesch nom,
I-chulle bidde on mine bare kneon : mi sone for þe[MS. me] wel sone.
beo studefast, ase þou hast bi-gonne[MS. bi-goume] : and he wole i-heore þi bone."
with þis word Teofle nuste : &yogh;ware ore leuedi bi-com.
he weop and cride euere &yogh;eorne : and al to hire grace him nom.
Þreo dawes with-oute mete and drinke : þare he gan a-bide
In wop and sor and deol j-nou&yogh; : on ore leuedi euere he criede.
Ore lauedi cam þo al li&yogh;inde : and with glade semblaunt also,
"Teofle," heo seide, "þou hast nouþe sone : penaunce i-nou&yogh; i-do;
beo glad and bliþe, for ich habbe i-bede : mine sone milce and ore,
Þat he hath þine sunnes þe fur-&yogh;yue. : ne sunegue þov nonmore!"
"I-hered beo þov," teofle seide : "and þi holie grace,
And i-blessed beo þe tyme þat ich to þe : criede in þusse place!
Leuedi, euere ich am a-drad : and siker nam ich nou&yogh;t,
Are þe chartre þat ich him[om. him] made : leuedi, to me beo i-brou&yogh;t :
Leuedi, þou art ful of milce : þat þou me schewest in þis place :
&YOGH;wane þi milce, leuedi, is so muche : do me þerof þine grace!"
"Nov sone, theofle," ore leuedi seide : "&yogh;eot ichulle þe milde beo,"
with þis word heo wende forth : þat he ne mi&yogh;te hire more i-seo.
hire milce heo scheowede, for heo cam : to him þene þridde day
And brou&yogh;te þe chartre and bi-tei&yogh;te as him : ase he a-slepe lay,
And wende a-&yogh;ein wel stillelicheâ€” : and þo Theofle a-wok,
Þe chartre he heold in is hond : þat ore leuedi him bi-tok.
glad and bliþe he was i-nou&yogh; : and me þunchez þat he wel ou&yogh;te!
Ore lauedie he þonkede and hire grace : þat to swuche guodnesse him brou&yogh;te.[al. 2 vv. more.]
¶ Þis cas bi-feol in leinte : on a satures-day at ni&yogh;t.
A-morewe, þene sonenday : þe day was cler and bri&yogh;t[al. as þe day was li&yogh;t],
Þe bischop and is clerkes : and muche folk al-so
to churche comen, ase ri&yogh;t was : godes seruise to do.
Ri&yogh;t þo godspel was i-rad : Theofle forth him wende,
To þe bischopes fet he feol a-doun : and þene Deuel more he schende :
he tolde þe bischope euerech del : and al þe folke al-so,
Þat foreward[MS. fereward] and þe sikernesse : þat he hadde þe Deuele i-do,
And hov of þe Deueles mi&yogh;te : ore swete leuedi him caste
And brou&yogh;te him þe chartres þat he made : þat bi-loke was in helle faste.
Þe chartre bi-fore al þat folk : he let þe bischope rede,
Þat ech man i-sei&yogh;e is luþere sunne : and ore leuedie mildhede.
Þa[t] folk wolde þe chartre witen : for miracle, þat[al. as] huy bede.
"A, Merci, merci, for godes loue" : Theofle ofte seide,
"For þe &yogh;wyle þe chartre is i-hol : &yogh;eot euere-more me dredeth;
Are heo beo to douste i-brent : siker lijf ne mai ich lede."
Þe chartre huy barnden bi-fore heom alle : þat ech man mi&yogh;te i-seo.
"Certes, nouþe ich hopie," theofle seide : "þat siker ich mouwe beo."
¶ Þo þe bischop hadde is masse i-do : þat folk cam mani-folde
A-boute Theofle in eche side : þat wonder to bi-holde.
bri&yogh;tore þane þe sonne, heom þou&yogh;te : he schon in-to al is face,
Þat non ne mi&yogh;te for bri&yogh;thede : bi-holde him in þat place.
he liet dele and &yogh;iue pouere men : þat[al. his] guod wel clene þere,
And seide þat he out of churche nolde : þe &yogh;wile he a-liue were.
To þe stude he wende a-non : þat[al. þer] ore leuedi to him a-li&yogh;te
And brou&yogh;te him þe chartres of is sunnes : þoru&yogh; hire swete mi&yogh;te.
A-non-ri&yogh;t he bi-gan to sikni : and þare ri&yogh;t a-doun lay;
his breþren he custe echone : and deide þene þridde day.

his soule wende to heuene[MS. henene] anon : þare I-cholde we alle were.
